title: THE TIMES - What are the fonts used today?
content:
Hi!

I'm looking to find out what are the headline and text faces currently in use in the printed version of The Times newspaper in the UK.

I know I probably should've already heard of this and I did read an article about the redesign not too long ago but now I can't seem to find out what they are, and to top it off searching for it elsewhere proved a fruitless effort as the only thing that would ever come up is Times New Roman. I know it's a stupid question but help me out here?

thank you :-)

Font: 

 Times Modern

comments.content:
Right, sorry! Sliped my mind.

Updated with today's front page :-)

Thanks. After some research, it's a bespoke (as almost all big tunas on this market) called ' [Times Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317062517/http:/www.researchstudios.com/2010/07/29/research-the-times)' by Research Studios under the Art Direction of its founder Neville Brody.  
2 nice alternatives and commercially available would be [Acta](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317062517/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/acta) family by Dino dos Santos and [Publico](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317062517/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fcommercialtype.com/typefaces/publico) by Christian Schwartz and Kai Bernau for Commercial Type (originally created for the Lisbon newspaper 'Público').
Thanks Ryuk!I wasn't looking for comercial alternatives, just doing a bit of research for uni but got stuck there. You've been of great help! :-)
